sentences.cn: 名义上信奉基督教的国家

sentences.en: Dad, nominally a methodist, enter church only for wedding and funeral.
sentences.cn: 爸名义上是卫理教教徒,可只去教堂参加婚礼和葬礼.

sentences.en: Dad, nominally a Methodist, entered Churches only for weddings and funerals.
sentences.cn: 爸名义上是卫理公会教徒, 可只去教堂参加婚礼和葬礼.

sentences.en: Dad, nominally a Methodist, entered Churches only weddings and funerals.
sentences.cn: 爸名义上是卫理公会教徒, 可只去教堂参加婚礼和“葬礼”.

sentences.en: Electronic systems guarantee that the clearance remains constant ( nominally 10 mm 3 ).
sentences.cn: 电子系统可确保空隙恒定 ( 即10毫米 ).

sentences.en: Even a nominally linear device can be linear only up to a certain limiting amplitude.
sentences.cn: 即使名义上为线性的装置,仅在某个有限的振辐之内才可能为线性.

sentences.en: He was nominally Deputy Prime Minister, certainly, but his influence was clearly on the wane.
sentences.cn: 当然，他名义上是副首相，但是显然他的影响力正在下降。

sentences.en: He was nominally in charge of his father’s printing company.
sentences.cn: 他名义上掌管着父亲的印刷公司。

sentences.en: He was nominally the leader, but others actually wielded the power.
sentences.cn: 名义上他是领导者, 但实际上是别人掌握实权.

sentences.en: Hydrogen partition coefficients between nominally anhydrous minerals and basaltic melts.
sentences.cn: 名义上的无水矿石和玄武岩熔点之间的氢分割系数.

sentences.en: Nominally she is the king's prisoner.
sentences.cn: 名义上她是国王的囚犯。

sentences.en: Nominally they are close relatives, but they don't see much of each other.
sentences.cn: 他们应名儿是近亲, 实际上不大来往.

sentences.en: The bureaucracy nominally under his control is huge and probably unmanageable.
sentences.cn: 名义上归他领导的那个官僚机构,庞大而且有些无法控制.

sentences.en: The dominant candidate is nominally nominated for president.
sentences.cn: 占优势的候选人名义上被任命为总统.

sentences.en: The laser chains are nominally 15 kilowatts, Marmo continues.
sentences.cn: 激光链通常为15千瓦, 马默继续解释说.

sentences.en: The Sultan was still nominally the Chief of Staff.
sentences.cn: 苏丹仍是名义上的参谋长。

words.tran_cn: 名义上的；有名无实的；[会计] 票面上的

trans.tran_cn: 在名义上，表面地，应名儿
trans.tran_en: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
